ArticleTitle.sentence: NF-X2 that binds to the DRA X2-box is activator protein 1.

AbstractText.sentence: Human class II MHC Ag are a family of cell surface glycoproteins.
Their constitutive expression is limited to B lymphocytes and thymic epithelial cells.

event.clue: Their constitutive expression is limited to B lymphocytes and thymic epithelial cells.
Their constitutive expression is limited to B lymphocytes and thymic epithelial cells.

AbstractText.sentence: In many other cells their expression can be induced by IFN-gamma.

event.clue: In many other cells their expression can be induced by IFN-gamma.

AbstractText.sentence: Conserved upstream promoter sequences regulate this tissue-specific expression of class II genes.

event.clue: Conserved upstream promoter sequences regulate this tissue-specific expression of class II genes.
Conserved upstream promoter sequences regulate this tissue-specific expression of class II genes.

AbstractText.sentence: In the DRA promoter, one of these cis-acting regulatory motifs is the X2-box to which nuclear factor X2 (NF-X2) binds.

event.clue: In the DRA promoter, one of these cis-acting regulatory motifs is the X2-box to which nuclear factor X2 (NF-X2) binds.

AbstractText.sentence: Here, we present the isolation and characterization of the full-length cDNA clone encoding NF-X2.
This cDNA clone was isolated by expression cDNA cloning, and encodes the human c-Jun protein, which together with c-Fos forms the heterodimeric activator protein-1 transcription complex.

event.clue: This cDNA clone was isolated by expression cDNA cloning, and encodes the human c-Jun protein, which together with c-Fos forms the heterodimeric activator protein-1 transcription complex.

AbstractText.sentence: Whereas c-Fos/c-Jun heterodimers do not exist in B cells, they form and bind to the X2-box in class II nonexpressing cells.

event.clue: Whereas c-Fos/c-Jun heterodimers do not exist in B cells, they form and bind to the X2-box in class II nonexpressing cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Thus, c-Fos/c-Jun heterodimers might contribute to the repression of DRA gene expression.
